Feedback
To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the &app; application or this manual, follow the directions in the GNOME Feedback Page.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The GNOME Ghostview (GGV) application enables you to view PostScript and Portable Document Format (PDF) files. The application is based on GNU GhostView. &app; runs the Ghostscript application in the background, which interprets PostScript and PDF files. &app; provides the user with a simple user interface to display PostScript or PDF files on screen or print the files to a printer.

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para:
Choose
Graphics GGV PostScript Viewer .
Type ggv, then press Return.
You can use command line options to modify the way in which you run &app;. To view the command line options that are available, type ggv --help, then press Return.

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.
The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: Menubar
The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands that you need to work with files in &app;. Choose Settings Show Menus to deselect this option and hide the menubar.
Toolbar
The toolbar contains a subset of the commands that you can access from the menubar. Choose Settings Show Toolbar to deselect this option and hide the toolbar.
Sidebar
The sidebar contains the following items:
Zoom spin box: enables you to enlarge or shrink the content of the display pane.
Toggle buttons: enable you to mark pages so that you can perform an action on the marked pages. The following toggle buttons are available:
Toggle all pages
Toggle odd pages
Toggle even pages
Unmark all pages buttons
See for more information about the toggle buttons.

Choose
Settings Show Sidebar to deselect this option and hide the sidebar.
Display pane
The display pane displays the PostScript or PDF file. Right-click in the display pane to invoke a popup menu.
Statusbar
The statusbar displays information about current application activity and contextual information about the menu items.

sect2.title: To Open a File
sect2.para:
To open a file, choose File Open
to display the Open File dialog. Select the file that you want to open, then click OK.
You can also drag files from another application, such as a file manager, to the &app; window. The application displays the files in new &app; windows.

sect2.title: To View a File
sect2.para: To view a file, you can use the following options:

listitem.para:
To view the next page, choose
View Next page .

To view the previous page, choose
View Previous page .

To view the first page in the file, choose
View First page .

To view the last page in the file, choose
View Last page .

If a page is larger than the display pane, use the scrollbars to scroll the current page. You can also use the arrow keys on the keyboard to scroll the current page. To view the whole page, choose
View Zoom Fit Window .

To enlarge or shrink the content that is displayed in the display pane, choose
View Zoom , then select the appropriate zoom level.

sect2.para:
To reload a file and update the display in the display pane, choose
File Reload .

sect2.title: To Change the Orientation of a File
sect2.para:
To change the orientation of a file, choose
View Orientation , then select the orientation option that you want.

note.para:
If the orientation of the file is set in the properties of the file, you must choose
View Orientation Override Orientation
before you can change the orientation of the file.

sect2.para: The orientation options are as follows:

sect2.title: To Change the Page Size of the File
sect2.para:
The page size of the file determines the height and width of each page in the file. To change the page size, choose
View Size , then select the page size that you want from the list of page sizes available.

note.para:
If the page size of the file is set in the properties of the file, you must choose
View Size Override Size before you can change the page size of the file.

sect2.title: To Mark Pages
sect2.para: You can mark pages in a file for the following reasons:

listitem.para: To print only marked pages.
To save only marked pages to a new file.

sect2.para: To mark and unmark pages, perform the following actions:

entry.para: Mark all of the pages in the file.
Mark all of the odd pages in the file.
Mark all of the even pages in the file.
Unmark the marked pages in a file.

sect2.para: To save the marked pages in a file to a new file, choose File Save marked pages . The Save marked pages dialog is displayed. Enter a name for the output file, then click OK. The application saves the pages to the new file, maintaining the original page numbers of the pages.

sect2.title: To Print a File
sect2.para:
To print a file to the default system printer, choose
File Print document . To print only the marked pages in a file, choose File Print marked pages .

sect2.title: To Close a File
sect2.para: To close a file, choose File Close . If you close the last file that is open, the application exits.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para:
To configure &app;, choose
Edit GGV Preferences . The GGV Preferences dialog contains the following tabbed sections:

listitem.para: Use this drop-down list box to specify the default zoom level for viewing files.
Default: 1:1.

As you move the mouse pointer around an open document, &app; displays the position of the pointer in the sidebar. Use this drop-down list box to specify the measurement unit in which to display the pointer position.
Default: inch.
Use this drop-down list box to specify the paper size to use if the properties of the file do not specify a paper size.
Default: Letter.
Select this option to use the paper size specified in the Fallback page size drop-down list box regardless whether or not a paper size is specified in the properties of the file.
Default: unselected.
Use this drop-down list box to specify the orientation in which to display a file if the properties of a file do not specify the orientation.
Default: Portrait.
Select this option to use the orientation specified in the Fallback media orientation drop-down list box regardless whether or not the orientation is specified in the properties of the file.
Default: unselected.
Select this option to use antialiasing to display the file. Antialiasing produces a better quality display.
Default: selected.
Select this option to instruct the application to acknowledge end-of-file comments.
Default: selected.
Select this option to monitor the content of the file that you are viewing and reload the file if the content changes.
Default: unselected.

term.guilabel: Outline last visible part when scrolling

listitem.para: Select this option to display a box around the last section of the document that &app; displayed when you are scrolling through the document.
Default: selected.
Select this option to show the side panel by default when you start the application.
Default: selected.
Information about this option will be provided in the next release of the manual.
Default: unselected.
Select this option to show the menubar by default when you start the application.
Default: selected.
Select this option to show the toolbar by default when you start the application.
Default: selected.
Select one of the following options to determine the style of the &app; toolbar:
Default: Use GNOME defaults
Select this option to show the statusbar by default when you start the application.
Default: selected.

Select this option to save the geometry of the &app; window and the Open File dialog when you quit the application. When you start the application again, &app; displays the windows using the saved geometry settings.
Default: unselected.

term.guilabel: Jump to beginning of page when using keyboard

listitem.para: Select this option to display the top left corner of the next or previous page when you use the Page Up and Page Down keys on the keyboard to navigate a file. To activate a change to this setting, you must restart the application.
Default: selected.
Type the command required to run the Ghostscript PostScript interpreter. Include the path to the Ghostscript executable file and any options that you want to use to run the application.
Default: system-specific-path/gs
Type the command required antialias a file.
Default: -s DEVICE=x11alpha
Type the command required to run Ghostscript and the options required to scan PDF files.
Default: system-specific-path/gs -dNODISPLAY -dQUIET -sPDFname="%s" -sDSCname="%s" pdf2dsc.ps -c quit
Type the command required to run the Gzip application to decompress a compressed .gz file. When &app; opens a compressed .gz file, &app; runs this command and opens the file.
Default: gzip -cd
Type the command required to run the Bzip2 application to decompress a compressed .bz2 file. When &app; opens a compressed .bz2 file, &app; runs this command and opens the file.
Default: bzip2 -cd
Type the command required to print a PostScript file from the &app; window.
Default: /usr/ucb/lpr
